definition:
If for the given $n$th prime $p_n$ the inequality
$$p_n < {1 \over 3} \sum_{i = n - 1}^{n + 1} p_i$$ is true, then $p_n$
is said to be a [*weak prime*]{}. That is, the arithmetic mean of the
given prime, the prime immediately below and the one immediately above,
is more than the middle prime. The first few are 3, 7, 13, 19, 23, 31,
43, 47, 61, 73, 83, 89, listed in A051635 of Sloane’s OEIS.
